clusters.title: Senate fails to advance funding package as ICE talks continue

items.title: Senate fails to advance funding package as ICE talks continue
items.standfirst: The Senate failed to advance legislation to fund major portions of the government as talks over reforming ICE continue.
items.content: The Senate failed to advance legislation to fund major portions of the government as talks over reforming ICE continue.

items.title: Senate fails to advance government funding bill, Democrats demand ICE reform
items.standfirst: The Senate failed to advance a government funding package Thursday with Democrats demanding reforms to immigration agencies. The deadline for a government shutdown is Saturday. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion reports.
items.content: The Senate failed to advance a government funding package Thursday with Democrats demanding reforms to immigration agencies. The deadline for a government shutdown is Saturday. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion reports.

items.title: Government funding package bill fails to clear key procedural hurdle in the Senate
items.standfirst: The Senate on Thursday failed to clear a key procedural hurdle on a crucial government funding package, with a shutdown set to ...
items.content: The Senate on Thursday failed to clear a key procedural hurdle on a crucial government funding package, with a shutdown set to ...

items.title: List of Republicans Who Voted Against Government Funding Bill
items.standfirst: Seven Republicans joined Democrats to vote against a funding bill that would prevent a government shutdown.
items.content: Seven Republicans joined Democrats to vote against a funding bill that would prevent a government shutdown.

items.title: Senate fails to advance spending package after Democrats refuse to back DHS funding
items.standfirst: US government could see shutdown on Friday as Democrats stall funding bill over immigration enforcement reformA key vote intended to head off a partial government shutdown failed in the Senate on Thursday, after Democrats refused to back funding for the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) unless it included reforms to federal agents involved in Donald Trump’s mass deportation campaign.However a Senate aide confirmed that Democrats have been negotiating with Republicans on a deal that could result in passage of most government funding bills and a short-term measure covering the DHS, which oversees Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and the US border patrol.Shrai Popat contributed reporting from Minneapolis Continue reading...
items.content: US government could see shutdown on Friday as Democrats stall funding bill over immigration enforcement reformA key vote intended to head off a partial government shutdown failed in the Senate on Thursday, after Democrats refused to back funding for the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) unless it included reforms to federal agents involved in Donald Trump’s mass deportation campaign.However a Senate aide confirmed that Democrats have been negotiating with Republicans on a deal that could result in passage of most government funding bills and a short-term measure covering the DHS, which oversees Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and the US border patrol.Shrai Popat contributed reporting from Minneapolis Continue reading...

items.title: Democrats block funding bill over ICE reforms
items.standfirst: Democrats halted a Senate spending bill Thursday, demanding immigration enforcement reforms following shootings in Minneapolis. The 45-55 vote blocked a package funding several agencies, including Hom...

items.title: Government Funding Bill Stalls in Senate. A Short Shutdown Is Likely
Senators block funding package amid DHS standoff
items.standfirst: Eight Republicans joined every Senate Democrat to block sweeping government funding legislation from advancing Thursday amid ongoing negotiations around a potential offramp to avert a lengthy shutdown of several agencies. The Senate voted 55-45 against moving forward with a six-bill package that…
items.content: Eight Republicans joined every Senate Democrat to block sweeping government funding legislation from advancing Thursday amid ongoing negotiations around a potential offramp to avert a lengthy shutdown of several agencies. The Senate voted 55-45 against moving forward with a six-bill package that…

items.title: Senate Dems block funding bill amid DHS overhaul fight
items.standfirst: Senate Democrats on Thursday blocked a package of government funding bills from advancing, as Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) inches toward a deal with President Trump for changes at DHS in exchange for averting a shutdown. Why it matters: Democrats spent the week pledging to block…

items.title: Democrats threaten shutdown if White House does not restrict ICE budget
items.standfirst: Senate Democrats say they will block legislation that would fund the Department of Homeland Security and several other agencies on January 28, potentially bringing the government a step closer to a partial shutdown if Republicans and the White House do not agree to new restrictions on President Donald Trump's surge of immigration enforcement. FRANCE 24's Fraser Jackson tells us more.
items.content: Senate Democrats say they will block legislation that would fund the Department of Homeland Security and several other agencies on January 28, potentially bringing the government a step closer to a partial shutdown if Republicans and the White House do not agree to new restrictions on President Donald Trump's surge of immigration enforcement. FRANCE 24's Fraser Jackson tells us more.

items.title: Watch: Schumer says DHS bill "still needs a lot of work," lists 3 goals to "rein in ICE"
items.standfirst: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer spoke on the chamber's floor ahead of a procedural vote to advance a government funding package. Schumer said the bill to fund the Department of Homeland Security "still needs a lot of work" and listed out three goals Senate Democrats have agreed on to "rein in ICE and stop the violence."
items.content: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer spoke on the chamber's floor ahead of a procedural vote to advance a government funding package. Schumer said the bill to fund the Department of Homeland Security "still needs a lot of work" and listed out three goals Senate Democrats have agreed on to "rein in ICE and stop the violence."

Thirty-six hours ahead of a shutdown that would affect most of the…

clusters.title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar announces run for Minnesota governor

items.title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar announces run for Minnesota governor
items.standfirst: Sen. Amy Klobuchar on Thursday launched her campaign to be Minnesota's next governor, a surprise twist in the race for the top job in the state as it experiences an unprecedented immigration enforcement operation that's ignited a national debate.
items.content: Sen. Amy Klobuchar on Thursday launched her campaign to be Minnesota's next governor, a surprise twist in the race for the top job in the state as it experiences an unprecedented immigration enforcement operation that's ignited a national debate.

items.title: Klobuchar announces she's running for Minnesota governor after Walz dropped bid

items.content: Sen. Amy Klobuchar's decision gives Democrats a high-profile candidate and proven statewide winner as their party tries to hold onto the office occupied by Gov. Tim Walz.

items.content: Sen. Amy Klobuchar has announced her bid for Minnesota governor. CBS News' Hunter Woodall reports.

items.title: US Senator Amy Klobuchar announces bid for Minnesota governor

items.title: Saying Minnesota has 'been through a lot,' Klobuchar announces bid for governor

items.content: Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar announced her run for Minnesota governor early Thursday. There is already a crowded field of Republicans in a race where immigration enforcement has become a key issue.(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)

items.title: Trump orders immediate reopening of commercial airspace over Venezuela
items.standfirst: Order allows direct flights from US to Venezuela, as major US oil companies already on ground to assess potential operationsDonald Trump has ordered the immediate reopening of commercial airspace over Venezuela, weeks after US military forces toppled dictator Nicolás Maduro.Speaking at the White House during his cabinet’s first meeting of the year, Trump said he had just concluded a telephone conversation with Venezuela’s acting president (and former vice-president), Delcy Rodríguez, in which he informed her of the decision to restore flight access. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

clusters.title: EU designates Iran’s Revolutionary Guards as a terrorist organisation
clusters.neutral_headline: EU designates Iran’s Revolutionary Guards as a terrorist organisation

items.title: EU designates Iran’s Revolutionary Guards as a terrorist organisation
items.standfirst: ‘Any organisation that kills thousands of its own people is working toward its own demise,’ says Kaja Kallas The EU has listed Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) as a terrorist organisation, ending years of division over the issue in response to the regime’s brutal repression of protesters.“Repression cannot go unanswered,” said Kaja Kallas, the EU’s foreign policy chief, on Thursday. The paramilitary organisation has played a significant role in suppressing demonstrations in Iran. “Any regime that kills thousands of its own people is working toward its own demise,” she wrote on X. Continue reading...
items.content: ‘Any organisation that kills thousands of its own people is working toward its own demise,’ says Kaja Kallas The EU has listed Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) as a terrorist organisation, ending years of division over the issue in response to the regime’s brutal repression of protesters.“Repression cannot go unanswered,” said Kaja Kallas, the EU’s foreign policy chief, on Thursday. The paramilitary organisation has played a significant role in suppressing demonstrations in Iran. “Any regime that kills thousands of its own people is working toward its own demise,” she wrote on X. Continue reading...

items.title: The European Union designates Iran Guards as 'terrorist organisation'
items.standfirst: European Union foreign ministers agreed on Thursday to include the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps on the bloc's list of terrorist organisations."This will put them on the same footing with Daesh, Hamas, Hezbollah, al-Qaida" explained European foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas. The move marks a symbolic shift in Europe's approach to Iran's ​leadership after years of disagreement between the 27 member states.
items.content: European Union foreign ministers agreed on Thursday to include the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps on the bloc's list of terrorist organisations."This will put them on the same footing with Daesh, Hamas, Hezbollah, al-Qaida" explained European foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas. The move marks a symbolic shift in Europe's approach to Iran's ​leadership after years of disagreement between the 27 member states.

items.title: EU adds Iran's Revolutionary Guards to terrorist list
items.standfirst: EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas says the move is a response to Tehran's deadly crackdown on protesters.
items.content: EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas says the move is a response to Tehran's deadly crackdown on protesters.

items.title: Replay: Iran Guard joins EU "terrorist list" in "diplomatic shift" for the block
items.standfirst: Rewatch as Kaja Kallas, European Commissionner to Foreign Affairs and Security Policy, addresses journalists following the European Union putting the Iranian Revolutionary Guard Corps on its "terrorist list". FRANCE 24's James André tells us more about what it means for the EU.
items.content: Rewatch as Kaja Kallas, European Commissionner to Foreign Affairs and Security Policy, addresses journalists following the European Union putting the Iranian Revolutionary Guard Corps on its "terrorist list". FRANCE 24's James André tells us more about what it means for the EU.

items.title: EU lists Iran's powerful Revolutionary Guards as terrorist organisation
items.standfirst: The European Union has listed Iran's paramilitary Revolutionary Guard as a terrorist organisation over Tehran's bloody crackdown on nationwide protests, the bloc's top diplomat said Thursday.
items.content: The European Union has listed Iran's paramilitary Revolutionary Guard as a terrorist organisation over Tehran's bloody crackdown on nationwide protests, the bloc's top diplomat said Thursday.

items.title: What is Iran's Revolutionary Guard, the paramilitary on the EU "terrorist list"?
items.standfirst: Created in the aftermath of the 1979 Islamic Revolution - the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps is now the most powerful organization in Iran. A parallel military force - the regime's armed wing and a major economic player - it plays a central role in repressing demonstrations, like in the widespread protests which took place recently and were submitted to a deadly crackdown. Now, the EU has inscribed the organisation on its "terrorist list". Who exactly are they?
items.content: Created in the aftermath of the 1979 Islamic Revolution - the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps is now the most powerful organization in Iran. A parallel military force - the regime's armed wing and a major economic player - it plays a central role in repressing demonstrations, like in the widespread protests which took place recently and were submitted to a deadly crackdown. Now, the EU has inscribed the organisation on its "terrorist list". Who exactly are they?

items.title: Former Illinois deputy sentenced to 20 years in prison for killing Sonya Massey
items.standfirst: Sean Grayson receives maximum possible sentence for second-degree murder conviction in 2024 fatal shootingA former Illinois sheriff’s deputy was sentenced on Thursday to 20 years in prison for fatally shooting Sonya Massey, who had dialed 911 to report a possible prowler outside her Springfield home.Sean Grayson, 31, was convicted in October. Grayson, who is white, received the maximum possible sentence. He has been incarcerated since he was charged in the killing. Continue reading...
items.content: Sean Grayson receives maximum possible sentence for second-degree murder conviction in 2024 fatal shootingA former Illinois sheriff’s deputy was sentenced on Thursday to 20 years in prison for fatally shooting Sonya Massey, who had dialed 911 to report a possible prowler outside her Springfield home.Sean Grayson, 31, was convicted in October. Grayson, who is white, received the maximum possible sentence. He has been incarcerated since he was charged in the killing. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Organic salmon certifier forced to share findings amid claims consumers misled
clusters.neutral_headline: Organic salmon certifier forced to share findings amid claims consumers misled

items.title: Organic salmon certifier forced to share findings amid claims consumers misled
items.standfirst: Information tribunal rules Soil Association must disclose salmon farm inspection reports to WildFish campaignersCampaigners have forced the Soil Association to reveal its salmon farm inspection reports, amid claims that certifying the farmed fish as “organic” is misleading to consumers.The Soil Association’s Organic scheme, the UK’s oldest and most widely recognised organic certification, defines organic farming as “using methods that benefit our whole food system, from people to planet, plant health to animal welfare.” Continue reading...
items.content: Information tribunal rules Soil Association must disclose salmon farm inspection reports to WildFish campaignersCampaigners have forced the Soil Association to reveal its salmon farm inspection reports, amid claims that certifying the farmed fish as “organic” is misleading to consumers.The Soil Association’s Organic scheme, the UK’s oldest and most widely recognised organic certification, defines organic farming as “using methods that benefit our whole food system, from people to planet, plant health to animal welfare.” Continue reading...

items.title: Ukraine receives bodies of 1,000 soldiers from Russia
items.standfirst: Ukraine and Russia confirm soldier body exchange, enabling families to bury loved ones as the conflict continues.
items.content: Ukraine and Russia confirm soldier body exchange, enabling families to bury loved ones as the conflict continues.

items.title: Ukraine receives 1,000 bodies in latest soldier swap with Russia
items.standfirst: Russia received 38 soldiers' bodies in exchange as part of an agreement between the warring countries.
items.content: Russia received 38 soldiers' bodies in exchange as part of an agreement between the warring countries.

clusters.title: China executes 11 members of scam mafia family
clusters.neutral_headline: China executes 11 members of Myanmar scam mafia

items.title: China executes 11 members of scam mafia family
items.standfirst: China has executed 11 members of a mafia family for killing 14 people and running a crime syndicate worth more than $1bn, authorities said.
items.content: China has executed 11 members of a mafia family for killing 14 people and running a crime syndicate worth more than $1bn, authorities said.

items.title: China executes 11 members of Myanmar scam mafia
items.standfirst: China executes 11 members of the Ming family that ran scam centres in Myanmar, state media report.
items.content: China executes 11 members of the Ming family that ran scam centres in Myanmar, state media report.

clusters.title: Plane crash kills 15 including politician
clusters.neutral_headline: Plane crashes in Colombia, killing all 15 on board

items.title: Plane crash kills 15 including politician
items.standfirst: A small passenger plane has crashed in northern Colombia, killing all 15 people on board, including a congressman.
items.content: A small passenger plane has crashed in northern Colombia, killing all 15 people on board, including a congressman.

items.title: Plane crashes in Colombia, killing all 15 on board
items.standfirst: State ariline Satena says its aircraft carrying 13 passengers and two crew "suffered a fatal accident".
items.content: State ariline Satena says its aircraft carrying 13 passengers and two crew "suffered a fatal accident".
